Detailed Description

Sample a full or partial hemisphere around a direction.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

mr::hemisphereSampler::hemisphereSampler (  const miVector &  Nin  )  [inline]
 

Constructor. Nin is the direction to sample around. spherePercent is percentage of sphere to cover. This call is to be used when sampling adaptively (ie. the number of samples to be taken are not known or may vary, or you may exit the loop early).

mr::hemisphereSampler::hemisphereSampler (  const miVector &  Nin,
const miUint &  numSamples
)  [inline]
 

Constructor. Nin is the direction to sample around. spherePercent is percentage of sphere to cover. numSamples is the number of samples to take. It HAS to be miUint&

mr::hemisphereSampler::~hemisphereSampler (   )  [inline]

bool mr::hemisphereSampler::cosine (  const miState *const  state,
const miScalar  max
)  [inline]
 

Get one sample using a cosine distribution over the max angle (expressed as a cosine [0,1]) or return false.

bool mr::hemisphereSampler::cosine (  const miState *const  state  )  [inline]
 

Get one sample using a cosine distribution over the whole hemisphere or return false.

const miScalar  max

Get one sample using a uniform distribution over the max angle (expressed as a cosine [0,1]) or return false.

bool mr::hemisphereSampler::uniform (  const miState *const  state  )  [inline]
 

Get one sample using a uniform distribution over the whole hemisphere or return false.

const miScalar mr::hemisphereSampler::weight (   )  [inline]
 

This returns a weight (dot product) of the sample with respect to the original Nin vector. Useful in uniform distributions only.
